user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish:
```c
void
MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME
  if (_MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV != mono_clock_service)
  {
    mach_port_deallocate (mach_task_self (),
                          mono_clock_service);
    mono_clock_service = _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV;
  }
#endif /* HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME */
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. The function MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish does not call itself directly, and it contains no calls to any other local/library functions that are defined within this translation unit which could call back into it. The only calls present (mach_port_deallocate and mach_task_self) are OS/Mach APIs — external system calls not defined here — and there are no function-pointer invocations, callbacks, or macro expansions in this snippet that would indicate an indirect call path back to MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish. The conditional compilation (HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME) only controls whether the block is compiled; it does not introduce recursion. The assignment to mono_clock_service is not a function call. Therefore, based on the provided code fragment alone, there is no direct or indirect recursion to investigate.
